title: Variables
summary: In programming, a variable is like a labeled box where you can store data. You give it a name, put a value inside, and can use that name later to retrieve the value.
sample_question: Can you explain what a variable is in your own words, and give me a real-world example?

title: Loops
summary: A loop is a programming structure that repeats a sequence of instructions until a specific condition is met. It helps avoid writing the same code over and over.
sample_question: What is the main difference between a For Loop and a While Loop?

title: Functions
summary: A function is a block of reusable code that performs a specific task. You can pass data into it, and it often returns a result back.
sample_question: Why do we use functions instead of writing all our code in one big list?
